abstract: James P. Gorman, who will become chief executive on Jan. 1, is moving to position the bank to better compete against its Wall Street rivals.
snippet: James P. Gorman, who will become chief executive on Jan. 1, is moving to position the bank to better compete against its Wall Street rivals.
lead_paragraph: Putting his stamp on one of the most venerable names on Wall Street, the incoming chief executive of Morgan Stanley announced a management shake-up on Tuesday that, for the most part, signaled a smooth transition of leadership.

headline.main: Morgan Stanley Shuffles Its Top Ranks
headline.print_headline: Morgan Stanley Shuffles Its Top Ranks
